definition: benefactor (term used by a monk to address a layperson)/donor (semiconductor)
surname Shi
to grant/to give/to bestow/to act/to carry out
owner/master/host/individual or party concerned/God/Lord/main/to indicate or signify/trump card (in card games)
donor level (semiconductor)

sentences.english: A chalcogen impurity center would have shallowerdonor binding energy with the increase of the atoms included in it.
sentences.chinese: 随着杂质中心上原子数目的增加，施主束缚能变浅。

sentences.english: One day, the dog fell sick and the donor asked She Li Zhi to recites sutra for it.
sentences.chinese: 有一天，母狗生病了，施主请舍利子尊者给它诵经。

sentences.english: Is it going to be an electron donor or acceptor?
sentences.chinese: 它应该是一个电子的施主还是受主？

sentences.english: During this process, the donor centres nearest the metal will lose their electrons.
sentences.chinese: 在这个过程中，最靠近金属的施主中心将失去其电子。

sentences.english: It was also counting on getting food aid from South Korea, its biggest donor.
sentences.chinese: 朝鲜当局当时还指望从其最大施主韩国获得粮食援助。

sentences.english: Visitors, do you know what the 6-digit number is?
sentences.chinese: 各位施主，你知道这个六位数是多少吗？

sentences.english: And the 2150cm-1 absorption peak is attributed to the hydrogen donor.
sentences.chinese: 吸收峰则被认为是由于氢施主所引起的。

sentences.english: You had better neglect your relations, than run the risk of offending your patroness.
sentences.chinese: 免得担那么大的风险，得罪了你的女施主。

definition: poor monk (humble term used by monk of himself)
(Buddhism) benefactor (designation of a lay person by a monk)
poor Taoist
Amitabha Buddha/the Buddha of the Western paradise/may the lord Buddha preserve us!/merciful Buddha!

brother (polite appellation for a friend one's age)
name in religion (of Buddhist or Daoist within monastery)
one of three fabled islands in Eastern sea, abode of immortals
square zhang (i.e. unit of area 10 feet square)/monastic room 10 feet square/Buddhist or Daoist abbot/abbot's chamber
a senior monk
monk/nun (Buddhist or Daoist)
lit. your honored carriage/your highness/honored Sir (also sarcastic)/you
young disciple (of the same master)/younger or junior male schoolmate

excellent
